thread.title: ServiceNow Surges 5%: ‘Crushed It,’ Says Mizuho - Tech Trader Daily
thread.title_full: ServiceNow Surges 5%: ‘Crushed It,’ Says Mizuho - Tech Trader Daily - Barrons.com

author: Tiernan Ray
title: ServiceNow Surges 5%: ‘Crushed It,’ Says Mizuho - Tech Trader Daily
text:
By Tiernan Ray Shares of cloud computing technology vendor ServiceNow ( NOW ) are up $4.64, or 5.4%, at $91, in late trading, after the company this afternoon reported Q4 revenue and profit that easily topped analysts’ expectations, and forecast this quarter’s revenue, and for the full year, higher as well.
Mizuho ‘s Abhey Lamba , reviewing the results in a first pass, remarked “Crushed it — no other way to describe the quarter.”
Revenue in the three months ended in December rose 35%, year over year, to $391.7 million, yielding EPS of 24 cents, excluding some costs.
Analysts had been modeling $379 million and 23 cents per share.
The company’s subscriptions revenue rose 43% to $350.3 million, while its “ professional services ” revenue was up 1% at $41.4 million.
Subscription “ billings ” rose 52%, year over year, to $483.9 million, the company said.
The company had $111.2 million in free cash flow.
For the current quarter , the company sees revenue of $406 million to $411 million, or $416 million to$421 million, excluding the effect of currency shifts, which is well above consensus for $402 million.
Subscription billings are expected to be $443 million to $447 million.
For the full year , the company sees revenue of $1.82 billion to $1.85 billion, or $1.86 billion to $1.89 billion on a currency-neutral basis.That is above the consensus for $1.79 billion.
CEO Frank Slootman said the company ended 2016 “with strong momentum” and that “our business is firing on all cylinders.” He said the company is now “the fastest growing enterprise software company with more than $1 billion in revenue.”
CFO Michael Scarpelli noted that the company’s backlog and deferred revenue was $2.8 billion, up 51%, which he said was faster than the prior year’s 35% annual increase.
Added Scarpelli, “Strength in Q4 was driven by a record 27 new deals greater than $1 million in net new annualized contract value, and 31 net new Global 2000 customer wins.”
